ddi:titlStmt.ddi:titl: Gentrification, inhabitants of expensive dwellings in Amsterdam and The Hague 1991
ddi:titlStmt.ddi:parTitl: Achter de schermen van de gentrification 1991 : De bewoners van dure woningen in Amsterdam en Den Haag

ddi:rspStmt.ddi:AuthEnty: Ebels, H.J., Ostendorf, W.J.M., Universiteit van Amsterdam * Amsterdam, Fac. ruimtelijke wetenschappen, vakgroep sociale geografie (primary investigator)
Vakgroep sociale geografie, faculteit der ruimtelijke wetenschappen, UvA * Amsterdam (data collector)

ddi:stdyInfo.ddi:abstract: Description of inhabitants of expensive, centrally located houses in Amsterdam and The Hague. Reasons for popularity of these kinds of houses / type of house: monument, nr. of rooms, ownership, price or rent / duration of living there, previous housing, consciously bought or rented ? / reasons for settling: aspects of the house, aspects of the neighbourhood, centrality and availability of facilities, personal motives / evaluation of housing situation: satisfaction with house, neighbourhood, living in a city, facilities ( schools, parks, sports, culture, restaurants, recreation, schools, public traffic ) / life style / propensity to move / reasons for moving / typology of household Background variables: basic characteristics/ housing situation/ household characteristics/ place of work/ occupation/employment/ income/capital assets/ education/ consumption of durables/ readership, mass media, and 'cultural' exposure
